What is the purpose of the OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER flag in Verus?

The OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER flag, set to 1024, determines where top-level ID and currency registration occur when not set on a gateway. Specifically, it ensures that these registrations happen on the launch chain.

ill publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```
What is the OPTION_NFT_TOKEN flag used for in Verus?

The OPTION_NFT_TOKEN flag, set to 2048, is used to create a single satoshi NFT (non-fungible token) that tokenizes control over the root ID. This means that the NFT token represents ownership and control of the root ID.

ill publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```
